articles.headline: Trump Isn’t Wrong on China Currency Manipulation, Just Late
articles.snippet: President Trump promised action against manipulation. But Beijing is now propping up the renminbi, not weakening it. The time to act was a decade ago.
articles.abstract: President Trump promised action against manipulation. But Beijing is now propping up the renminbi, not weakening it. The time to act was a decade ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: Has the United States mismanaged the ascent of China?

articles.headline: White House Accuses Russia of Cover-Up in Syria Chemical Attack
articles.snippet: In a declassified report, White House officials said the Syrian and Russian governments sought to confuse the world about the assault through disinformation and “false narratives.”
articles.abstract: In a declassified report, White House officials said the Syrian and Russian governments sought to confuse the world about the assault through disinformation and “false narratives.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House accused Russia on Tuesday of engaging in a cover-up of the Syrian government’s role in a chemical weapons attack last week, saying that United States intelligence had confirmed that the Assad regime used sarin gas on its own people.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: United Grapples With PR Crisis Over Videos of Man Being Dragged Off Plane
articles.snippet: The videos cast an unwelcome light not just on United, but on the airline industry’s efforts to maximize profits.
articles.abstract: The videos cast an unwelcome light not just on United, but on the airline industry’s efforts to maximize profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Airlines on Tuesday faced a spiraling crisis from videos showing a passenger being dragged off an airplane, as consumers threatened a boycott of the airline and lawmakers called for an investigation. By the afternoon, after more than a day of changing statements, United’s chief executive apologized and promised a review of its policies.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell and Sapna Maheshwari

articles.headline: A Woman’s Death Sorting Grapes Exposes Italy’s ‘Slavery’
articles.snippet: Paola Clemente, 49, died in 2015 of a heart attack at a vineyard. An investigation found female laborers were routinely exploited and their pay skimmed.
articles.abstract: Paola Clemente, 49, died in 2015 of a heart attack at a vineyard. An investigation found female laborers were routinely exploited and their pay skimmed.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN GIORGIO IONICO, Italy — Her husband can still recall how Paola Clemente used to set two alarms to make sure she woke in the middle of the night — 1:50 a.m. — to catch the private bus that would take her and dozens of other women to the vineyards.

articles.headline: Tesla’s Market Surge Has Even Fans Looking for Feet of Clay
articles.snippet: Investors have been energized by the electric-car maker’s upbeat outlook for delivering its mass-market model. Now its chief, Elon Musk, must deliver.
articles.abstract: Investors have been energized by the electric-car maker’s upbeat outlook for delivering its mass-market model. Now its chief, Elon Musk, must deliver.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the past four weeks, exuberant investors have driven up the share price of Tesla, putting the upstart in the league of car companies that have been in the business for a century.

articles.headline: Trump’s Shift on Russia Brings Geopolitical Whiplash
articles.snippet: Accusations that President Trump is too close to Russia have given way to a new toughness demonstrated by the administration.
articles.abstract: Accusations that President Trump is too close to Russia have given way to a new toughness demonstrated by the administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A week ago, President Trump was accused of being a tool for the Russians, an unwitting agent of influence, so full of admiration that he defended President Vladimir V. Putin against critics who called him a killer.

articles.headline: How Technology Has Failed to Improve Your Airline Experience
articles.snippet: Silicon Valley prides itself on its capacity to upend entrenched industries. But airlines have eluded tech disruption.
articles.abstract: Silicon Valley prides itself on its capacity to upend entrenched industries. But airlines have eluded tech disruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are many reasons for the sorry state of commercial aviation in America. When it comes to your routinely terrible flight — not to mention the sort of exceptional horror that took place aboard United Airlines Flight 3411 last weekend — regulatory failures as well as consolidation, which the authorities have allowed to occur unabated for decades, can be blamed.

articles.headline: Venezuela Staves Off Default, but Low Oil Prices Pose a Threat
articles.snippet: With dwindling reserves and political turmoil, the government is juggling assets and leaning on its American subsidiary, Citgo, to meet payment needs.
articles.abstract: With dwindling reserves and political turmoil, the government is juggling assets and leaning on its American subsidiary, Citgo, to meet payment needs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Venezuela has put off a reckoning on its tens of billions of dollars in debt, but its ability to avoid a disastrous default will probably require much higher oil prices than appear likely in the next year or two, financial experts say.

articles.headline: U.S. Takes Sharper Tone on Russia’s Role in Syria
articles.snippet: President Trump’s hopes for an alliance faded as he and his administration publicly chastised President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s hopes for an alliance faded as he and his administration publicly chastised President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson sought on Wednesday to isolate President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia for backing the Syrian government in the wake of its lethal chemical weapons attack on civilians, and worked to build international pressure on Moscow to change course.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and David E. Sanger
